storyInfo: Federico, following the directions of the captain of the Gendarmerie, arrives at his former residence. Playing the piano, he realizes that Arturia's purpose may not yet be fulfilled. The old Lich takes the Voice of Mundane, but fails to summon the Genesis Horn.

attributes.content: ...The rising of the Urticas' secret chamber destroyed the original plate of Ludwigs-Universität. Coupled with the influence of Herkunftshorn's Arts, the school can no longer function normally.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: For now, the Empresses' Voice have taken over the cleanup operation from the Gendarmerie. Unaffected students and faculty have been relocated to neighboring Ostendorfhof.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The cleanup will take about a week. Thereafter, they will be able to return to campus...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: No need. Ludwigs-Universität's library will be relocated to Neuleopoldshof and fall under the purview of the Reichsmuseum. The other campuses and faculties will be merged into the Reichskunstakademie in Bachshof.
The Gesatzswächter will be in charge of disposing of all of the remaining plates belonging to Urtica.
But then Ludwigs-Universität will—
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Ludwigs-Universität will become history.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Your Majesty...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Are you surprised?
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: When I received the summon, I thought—
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You thought I would be Lieselotte.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: My apologies.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You did well. Lieselotte thinks very highly of you.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Danke schön, Your Majesty. If you hadn't graced us with your presence yesterday...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's behind us, no need to speak of it again.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Your Majesty... there is one other thing.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Arturia... the wanted Sankta, I bumped into her, and she mentioned my father.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I would like to know if she had something to do with his death. If you would permit me...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: We've been over this, Hochberg.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: The case of the Witch King's remains stealing a copy of the Güldenesgesatz has been closed.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Brandt.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Your Majesty, you are here as well.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Have you come to see Cora?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: She is currently rehearsing the Güldenesgesatz. The delay caused by the Witch King's remains has us all worried about tomorrow's performance.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Rest assured, the Movement is flawless at all times.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Cora said the same. How long have you gone without a break? Why not take a vacation after the Celebration?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: You could go back to Sturmland together. Not as a Reichsorchester tuner and Gesatzswächter, but as Cora and Brandt.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: This is a reward, not a punishment. For mopping up the Witch King's remains. You and Viviana have done fine work, and I've taken notice.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Just remember that... opportunity does not last forever. Some things must be said before it's too late.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Thank you, Your Majesty, for the reminder.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: And another thing, I'll need at least twenty Gesatzswächter for tomorrow's Celebration.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Does Grimmacht know about this...?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Every year, Das Kaiserinnensfest begins with Reichsorchester's performance of the Güldenesgesatz, and ends with my duet with Hildegard.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I wonder.... This year, will the people still appreciate our performance?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: ...I have no doubt, Your Majesty.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Could I ask you a question, Brandt?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: By all means.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Assume your most prized possession has a crack in it. Would you... turn a blind eye to it? Pretend you didn't notice?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: You're going to leave Zwillingstürme?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Arturia is under control. I will return to Laterano and report to His Holiness the Pope. We will subsequently seek formal legal cooperation from Leithanien.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Alright. But I should remind you... tomorrow is Das Kaiserinnensfest.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Zwillingstürme will be very lively. Young people from other regions, even other countries, will all join in the merrymaking.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Correct, I had noticed an increase in foot traffic.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And so, I want to ask... Herr Executor, won't you stay just one more day?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Please explain why I'd do that.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Um... Arturia has been apprehended, the copy of the Güldenesgesatz has been recovered, and the Witch King's remains have been more or less wiped out. It seems like everything's all taken care of, but I can't shake this uneasy feeling.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Grimmacht says I have a unique sense for danger... I mean, of course, it might just be my imagination.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: For matters pertaining to internal Leithanian affairs, I suggest you confer with your empress.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: She's been too busy to see me today.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: So that's why you have time to escort me out of the city? I had assumed this was an official duty.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: A duty? No, it's not my duty to monitor you.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: And, err, having come all the way to Zwillingstürme, wouldn't you like to stay a bit longer? Make some new friends? See the sights?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Friends and sights...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Are you looking at... that coffee shop?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I could try the drink Loris recommended before I leave.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: H-Herr Sankta!
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: You are Yulia's brother, Jan. Do you work at this coffee shop?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Ja, I need to save money so I can study abroad when I'm ready. I thought I'd never see you again.
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: I've heard that the executors of the Lateran Notarial Hall carry out the wills of Lateran citizens, is that right?
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: An acceptable summary.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And you also... solve cases?
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: So long as it is part of a binding document, I will do everything in my power to carry it out.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Wunderbar! Loris left me a key before he died. He said there were clues about my sister's case in his house.
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: But I'm not a detective after all, and wasn't sure who to give the key to.
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: This is the residence of Loris Bordin.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: This is a home in Zwillingstürme! You've barely known Bordin for an afternoon and he left you his entire house?!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: What he left me are clues to a case.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Look—The wall, the table, the drawers, everywhere.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: These are all clues regarding Yulia Schüler, the girl who disappeared over ten years ago.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And... a letter.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Loris claimed to have accepted defeat. But actually, he never gave up on the case.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I almost forgot that you're a case-solving machine. Even if they made you a Graf and granted you the tallest spire in Zwillingstürmeshof, you'd hardly blink, would you?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: A false premise, that is. There is no precedent for a Lateran saint being conferred a title by another country.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And what do you have to do with Lateran sainthood...? Are you suggesting that you, Herr Executor, bear the title of Saint?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Like the Founders and the Popes?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I am unclear on what you mean by 'like' in this context, but nominally yes.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...I may need to reevaluate our need to monitor you, Herr Saint.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You are an 'executor' to an empress. I had assumed you had some familiarity with my background.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I thought I did too.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Do not worry. Whether or not I hold the title of saint is not particularly relevant to my work in Leithanien.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: My executorial duty is to capture Arturia, as well as executing the wills of Lateran citizens.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: As the Arturia case is on temporary hold, fulfilling the will of Loris Bordin is my next objective.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Was that... hesitation? I've never seen you hesitate before!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I still have questions about the Arturia case.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What questions?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I need to think.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico looks at the piano to the side of the room.
Like most Leithanians, Loris had musical instruments in his home. However, judging from the many files and folders on its bench, he did not play the piano often.

Simply tap the black and white keys in a certain rhythm and a melody will be created. People have taken such immediate feedback for granted, yet there are still many questions that, once sprouted, are pushed away, unanswered.
The piece you just played... is it the one from yesterday at Ludwigs-Universität?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Der Tod des Hexenkönigs.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Arturia interpreted the emotions of Loris Bordin and Brandt Reiner, as well as the others who witnessed the Witch King's demise. She turned their strongest feelings into notes, creating this piece.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I want to know what she discovered in those emotions.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The notes may be the same, but the feelings are so different.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Herr Executor, are you and Arturia really related by blood? If misplaying an instrument were a crime, you might well be arrested as soon as you step out the door.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I did not play a single note wrong.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But there was no emotion whatsoever! You can't grasp music by memorizing its rules. You have to... um... picture the emotion it conveys.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: For example, Loris Bordin. You have to become him, imagine the night he charged into the Witch King's Spire. Picture how he became a hero, how crestfallen he was by Yulia's case, and...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: When you're finally forced to doubt yourself, and find yourself wavering, lost, like me... you'll realize that you need a strength, a reason.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: And that's when you'll discover that the law offers no guidance.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Why do barriers never cease to be? Is mankind doomed never to understand one another?
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: The tiniest chaos is enough to shatter the order. The moment confusion envelops, people begin to hurt one another...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Each era has its own trials and tribulations, for which we can only prepare to the best of our ability. It is certain, however, that you have been chosen because It believes that you have the ability to respond to the unknown.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: You are well aware that there is another besides yourself very unique among the Sankta.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Bring her back, if possible. I need to meet with her, face to face.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Fede, your whole life, you have been different, different from all the others.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Can you really... not see everything I see in the music?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Thanks to Grimmacht, both my ears and my soul have been saved.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: A failed attempt, I take it? Let's not try that again. We have to acknowledge that some people simply lack the talent for music.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Yes, I cannot empathize with Loris or anyone else, nor do I see the illusions created by the notes.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But I do have realized that emotions are also information.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What do you mean by that?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: As you said, Arturia's performances are completely different from mine. The notes arranged in order have no inherent meaning, but with added emotion, they become a piece of music beloved by you people.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And so, I have come to understand that emotion is a kind of additional information.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Arturia played her music, playing the hearts of Loris and others, to extract information from their powerful emotions that even they themselves could not retrieve.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: This is something only Arturia can do.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Her objective has not yet been achieved, nor will she abandon it. There will be even greater chaos in the coming days, here in Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...Are you certain?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I could spend time explaining the finer logic to you, but I assess that you will find it difficult to share my thought process. As such, I suggest you consider my conclusion a kind of... intuition.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Herr Executor, there is someone you should see. She can help you.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Congratulations, you're about to be rid of me.

What, I shouldn't say such things? What would you rather hear? Mockery, anger, curses? Or a seemingly invincible enemy pulled straight from a story begging for mercy before their departure from the stage?
Don't forget, you wanted to see me. Whenever you have doubts, you unconsciously seek out my voice.
You want to hear me deny you, and then, in denying me, you can win some silly comfort for yourself.
It is not I who needs you. You need me.
Bloodline of Urtica, Franz, Ebenholz——Without me, what does your future hold?
It's done.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: What do you mean...? What's done?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I've removed the Voice of Mundane from your head.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But nothing happened, is that it? It could never summon the Genesis Horn in the first place!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: It's like watching a crowd of people nervously gathering to light a fuse and blow Zwillingstürme up, only to hear a soft pop like a gloompincer's depressing fart.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: But didn't you say the melody of the Witch King could open the door to the Genesis Horn?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Yes, the right melody. Do you think you can open a locked door with any old key?! Don't compare my research on Herkunftshorn with the pile of rubbish they stuffed into your brain.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Those idiots and their Infected bombing couldn't manage a thing!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Ha, 'The Voice of Mundane'... Do the people who come up with this stuff even know the difference between a proper creation and a belch?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Was it Gerhard who filled your heads with all this? Would you mind if I dug him up and knocked him around a bit more?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: But they told me the Voice of Mundane housed the Witch King's avatar.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Avatar? Haha... avatar.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: That'd be like me rolling my soul into a ball and tossing it into the amphitheater beneath the spire for you stupid lambs to kick about. You really think that can be done?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: That's enough, boy. I'm in a bad mood, a positively rotten one. I thought by doing this one last favor for Grimmacht, I'd be able to take my things and finally be rid of this wretched place.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Who'd have thought those masked morons would make a fool of me... No, they made me a whole circus!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I should have Ermengarde look me over, see if a Lich's age has any effect on his brain.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: He said... The Voice of Mundane is just noise.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It is certainly a melody left by the Witch King, that's true. But Gerhard and his men misunderstood its power. It isn't the key to the Witch King's legacy.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Then what about the... voice in my head?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't understand the Arts behind it.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The problem of the Voice of Mundane has been resolved. You may still suffer headaches and hallucinations, but I expect they won't be so bad going forward.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Just to be safe, you should stay here and rest a while. Then leave Zwillingstürme after Das Kaiserinnensfest.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: So, the voice is just my imagination then?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: All these years, and all of my struggles were just in my head? In the somewhat more figurative sense?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Apparently, I have nothing whatsoever to do with any grand plans of those lofty conspirators.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And to speak of killing myself before I went mad... Hah, I've been mad for a long, long time.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't have time to discuss this with you.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: ...Right.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You grandfather says that the rubbish in my head tainted the research on Herkunftshorn. So why care about me, an inferior product? Particularly after we've known that none of his power lies within me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I can't summon a Catastrophe cloud with a wave of my hand, nor can I cleave a spire with a swing of a sword—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What do you want?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The power is still there. Since you've removed the Voice of Mundane, why not... kill me?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Voice of Mundane is not the key, meaning I'm of no use to the Twin Empresses. Why not burn me and mine to ashes, like all the experiments of the Witch King era?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Because there is no...
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: ...No need? Is that it?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then what about my brother? He died. He died because of a stupid plan like... To borrow a phrase, like a gloompincer's depressing fart. Such nonsense... such irony!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: He was grateful, you know, right up until he died... Grateful for our meeting, grateful for the instructor who taught him the cello.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But our meeting was exploited by Gertrude. The teacher he admired was mixed up with the Witch King's remains.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hah, and now you tell me... you tell me the Voice of Mundane was all a wacky misunderstanding the entire time!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: So we lived, died, met, parted, all for what? Where is the meaning in any of it?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Alright, if you want an answer, I'll tell you.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You're right. There was no meaning in any of it.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Set aside the Urtica name. Without the Voice of Mundane, you're nothing but a self-absorbed, self-harming, self-destructive empty shell of a pretty boy.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Perfect. You finally did it.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Now take up your Arts Unit.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Why not unwrap the bandages on your sword? That would make this execution go even smoother.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The man before me is unworthy of it.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Even now, you just have to humili—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then fight back. Prove me wrong by your actions.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You loathe the bloodline of the Witch King. But have you ever sought out the victims of his persecution? To make amends, to help them, to compensate them?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You loathe the title of Graf Urtica. But have you ever looked into the safety of the commoners? Taken note of the decline of your domain, caught between the Twin Empresses and the Witch King's remains?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You lament being the only survivor. But you have not been cherishing the life ahead of you. Instead, you constantly throw yourself into danger.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You say you were a prisoner of your spire. But who, in the end, has never looked beyond his cage at anyone else?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Lessing's sword moves so quickly that dodging is nearly impossible. He's rarely spoken so many words in one breath.
At first, Ebenholz had no intention of dodging, but almost instinctively, the Originium dice float into the air. Arts pour out uncontrollably, like fiery rage.
Blood, title, duty, everything was forced upon me by fate.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I tried! I stood against it! And in the end, you tell me there was never any need to!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Why? Why did I have to go through all this when I'm nobody at all?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Lessing's sword presses against Ebenholz's throat. The Originium dice fall to the side.
The battle is over, the outcome a surprise to no one.
Our fight against fate never belonged to any of us. And so, what does the suffering we've endured... even count for?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I never received a noble's education, and I don't throw around words like 'fate.'
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I only know that all the suffering is real.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I've seen street hawkers beaten by the Gendarmerie in the alleyways. I've seen old men freeze to death on the roadside after losing their farmland to the rural nobility.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: They'll never see the Witch King, the Twin Empresses, or a Kurfürsten in their life. They'll never have the time or energy to contemplate fate, suffering, or meaning.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: That's life in the shadow of the spires, for the great masses of Leithanien.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: No one can overcome an abstract concept. If you want revenge, choose a concrete target. The Witch King, the Twin Empresses, the still living remnants.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: We fight to survive. And we don't stop until our own blood or that of our enemies runs dry.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Fight...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Witch King's legacy still exists, wherever it is. Enemies shrouded in darkness may find it at any moment, and use it to unleash suffering on the great masses once again.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You can stay in this spire and continue lamenting your 'fate,' or you can challenge me again and die by my hand.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Or... you can join me in seeking the Witch King's legacy. Help me find the true culprit, who may still be alive in some form.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Choose.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Ebenholz feels the sword against his throat, still wrapped in bandages. Were it not wrapped, he would have smelled blood.
Of course, this does not mean that Lessing can't kill him. The warrior's expression is cold, but his eyes burn with anger.
Why is he angry?
Why... does he still have expectations for a man like him?
Would you kindly pass me my Arts Unit?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Why aren't they here?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Frau Hochberg, what is it you're looking for?
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Sketches... Frieda Seemann's drawings.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Since Herr Reiner and I left, has anyone else been in this room?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Um... no suspicious individuals, meine Dame.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: After you and Herr Gesatzswächter left, the Imperial casters carefully inspected the entire alley.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: After confirming no traces of the Witch King's remains, and no dangerous witchcraft or items, they left.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Are the drawings you're looking for involved in some important case?
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: A case?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Viviana recalls Grimmacht's words.
'The case of the Witch King's remains stealing a copy of the Güldenesgesatz has been closed.'
No.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's merely personal. Frau Seemann's work is incredibly beautiful. It always evokes some... marigold memories in me.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Please don't alert the others though. I don't want too many people to know I've been here.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Of course! Rest assured. The Gendarmerie will never disclose your movements.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: So lovely. Marigolds, sunlight... such beautiful things tend to inspire creativity and nurture emotion.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: No wonder so many Leithanian artists love this alley. Werner von Hochberg... He was obsessed with it until the day he died.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: Might you be... Frau Giallo? Weren't you taken away by Grimmacht's casters?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm certainly not here.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: And you didn't really bump into your father back there either.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: This is all in your imagination.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: Is this also an effect of your Arts?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You're rather skilled in Originium Arts yourself. What do you think?
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: I... haven't noticed anything unusual.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: People often misunderstand my Arts. The truth is, I can't do very much at all. People are just ignorant of their own hearts. Or even if they do know, they're unwilling to face themselves.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: I told you the first time we met. My melodies resonate with the emotions deep inside the human heart... and once they ripple, they are hard to ignore.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: It's you who wants to change your father's fate. The one talking to you now, well, I'm afraid it's you yourself.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: ...Is that so?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You yearn to know the cause of your father's death.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: You fear that the conspiracy of the Witch King's remains is not yet through. You suspect that the farce performed at Ludwigs-Universität was just a diversion.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: You wonder... if perhaps the Kaiserinnen wanted to kill the Kurfürst?
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: Nein.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Ah, but you see, you can't hold back the birth of this thought.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: If your father were standing here, what would he do?
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: My father...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: He wouldn't do anything.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: He would accept fate's plan, and turn away.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Even though he would go on to live with endless pain and regret.
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: And so, what about you? Would you... do the same?
attributes.name: 'Arturia'

attributes.content: He and I...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Frau Giallo?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Do not mistaken me for that distant relative of mine. There is no need for you to brandish your Arts Unit in my direction.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...This whole area is encircled by Leithanien's finest Gendarmerie.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Who are you, Herr Sankta?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I am an executo— I work with Michael.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Michael is a good boy. I guess... I can trust you.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: That went surprisingly well.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: At Michael's suggestion, I would like to provide a clue regarding Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: There is a high probability that she is planning an even more serious incident.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Seniora Viviana von Hochberg, it is my hope that we can cooperate, and put a stop to her plans.
attributes.name: Federico
